intro: Sutera pulchra, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sutera pulchra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
